subject: Horses
Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Officials at a Kentucky racetrack are trying to determine if their ban on a certain type of shoe aimed at making racing safer had the opposite effect. Turfway Park in Florence reported that eight horses died from racing injuries during its 21-day holiday meet that ended Dec. 31. During the same meet in 2007, which had six additional race days, four horses died on the track and another in the paddock. Bryce Peckham, the chief veterinarian for the Kentucky Horse Racing Commission, disclosed the figures Tuesday at the commission’s first meeting of the year.
